page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY (1)
page.content: The name Framwellgate Moor comes from the old English and Scandinavian languages.Framwell meaning "a spring" and Gate meaning "a street".The name may mean "the street of the strong spring." Pity Me comes from the Norman French,"PETIT MER",meaning a small lake and there is evidence to prove that one existed. In the Boldon book,Framwellgate Moor is described as a hunting ground for the Bishops of Durham.The area was agricultral and contained 18 farms at one time.The main landowners between 1809-1838 were Liddell and Russell. In the 19th Century colleries developed.In 1901 a census revealed that there were 5105 people living in the parishes and 1000 men worked at the colleries.
